pageProps.contentHtml:
harmonic functions

Let Δj={z∣∣z−aj∣≤rj}\Delta_j = \set{z \mid \abs{z - a_j} \leq r_j}Δj​={z∣∣z−aj​∣≤rj​}, 1≤j≤n1 \leq j \leq n1≤j≤n, be a collection of disjoint closed disks, with radii rj≥0r_j \geq 0rj​≥0, all contained in the open unit disk D\DD of the complex plane. Let Ω=D∖(⋃jΔj)\Omega = \D \setminus \p{\bigcup_j \Delta_j}Ω=D∖(⋃j​Δj​) and let u ⁣:Ω→R\func{u}{\Omega}{\R}u:Ω→R be harmonic. prove that there exist real numbers c1,…,cnc_1, \ldots, c_nc1​,…,cn​ such that

u(z)−∑j=1ncjlog⁡ ∣z−aj∣u\p{z} - \sum_{j=1}^n c_j\log\,\abs{z - a_j}u(z)−j=1∑n​cj​log∣z−aj​∣

is the real part of a (single-valued) analytic function on Ω\OmegaΩ. Show also that the choice of c1,…,cnc_1, \ldots, c_nc1​,…,cn​ is unique.
Solution.

Let uuu be a harmonic function on Ω\OmegaΩ, and consider its conjugate differential

∗du=−∂u∂y dx+∂u∂x dy.{}^*\diff{u} = -\pder{u}{y} \,\diff{x} + \pder{u}{x} \,\diff{y}.∗du=−∂y∂u​dx+∂x∂u​dy.

For each jjj, let cj=∫∂Δj∗duc_j = \int_{\partial\Delta_j} {}^*\diff{u}cj​=∫∂Δj​​∗du and consider

v(z)=∑j=1ncj2πlog⁡ ∣z−aj∣.v\p{z} = \sum_{j=1}^n \frac{c_j}{2\pi} \log\,\abs{z - a_j}.v(z)=j=1∑n​2πcj​​log∣z−aj​∣.

Observe that ∗dv=∑j=1ncj2π dθj{}^*\diff{v} = \sum_{j=1}^n \frac{c_j}{2\pi} \,\diff\theta_j∗dv=∑j=1n​2πcj​​dθj​ so that

∫∂Δk∗dv=∑j=1ncjδjk=ck  ⟹  ∫∂Δk∗d(u−v)=0\int_{\partial\Delta_k} {}^*\diff{v} = \sum_{j=1}^n c_j\delta_{jk} = c_k \implies \int_{\partial\Delta_k} {}^*\diff\p{u - v} = 0∫∂Δk​​∗dv=j=1∑n​cj​δjk​=ck​⟹∫∂Δk​​∗d(u−v)=0

by construction. Let f=ux−iuyf = u_x - iu_yf=ux​−iuy​ so that f dz=du+i∗duf \,\diff{z} = \diff{u} + i{}^*\diff{u}fdz=du+i∗du. Hence, by Cauchy's theorem and taking imaginary parts, we see that for any closed γ⊆Ω\gamma \subseteq \Omegaγ⊆Ω,

∫γ∗d(u−v)=∑j=1nW(γ;aj)∫∂Δk∗d(u−v)=0,\int_\gamma {}^*\diff\p{u - v} = \sum_{j=1}^n W\p{\gamma; a_j}\int_{\partial\Delta_k} {}^*\diff\p{u - v} = 0,∫γ​∗d(u−v)=j=1∑n​W(γ;aj​)∫∂Δk​​∗d(u−v)=0,

where W(γ;aj)W\p{\gamma; a_j}W(γ;aj​) is the winding number of γ\gammaγ around aja_jaj​. Thus, u−vu - vu−v has a harmonic conjugate, i.e., u−vu - vu−v is the real part of a holomorphic function on Ω\OmegaΩ. To show uniqueness, observe that

∑j=1ncjlog⁡ ∣z−aj∣\sum_{j=1}^n c_j \log\,\abs{z - a_j}j=1∑n​cj​log∣z−aj​∣

is the real part of a holomorphic function on Ω\OmegaΩ if and only if cj=0c_j = 0cj​=0 for all jjj.
